title: Admissions | Future Students | SF State
content:
Admissions at San Francisco State University
Welcome to San Francisco State University, where all are welcome. No matter where you’re from, what you’ve learned or who you think you’ll be, we’re ready to be the next chapter in your story.
At SF State, we champion equity and community inclusion to ignite the power of education for all so you can go on to thrive in a global society.
Submit your application at Cal State Apply
Find Your Major
Wherever your story leads, SF State is dedicated to empowering you to pursue your educational dreams bravely, confidently and passionately.
Areas of Study
Colleges
Academics
Bachelor’s degrees in 82 academic areas with an additional 41 areas of concentration
Master’s degrees in 63 academic areas with an additional 32 areas of concentration
Doctor of Education (Ed.D.) in Educational Leadership with two concentrations
Ph.D. in Education with a concentration in special education
Clinical doctorate of physical therapy (D.P.T.), jointly with UC San Francisco
13 credential programs and 54 certificate programs
Learn about our seven colleges
Lam Family College of Business
College of Ethnic Studies
College of Health & Social Sciences
College of Liberal & Creative Arts
College of Professional & Global Education
College of Science & Engineering
Graduate College of Education
Ever since it was established in 1899 as a teacher training school, SF State has been known for its commitment to educational excellence. Students work closely with senior professors and other instructors from freshman year through graduation. Trained in some of the finest institutions in the world, faculty members include winners of prestigious teaching awards, cutting-edge researchers and professionals devoted to solving community problems.
Learn more about undergraduate academics
.
How to Apply
Nearly 22,000 students enroll each year, and every day our network of more than 293,000 graduates contributes to the economic, cultural and civic life of the Bay Area and beyond.
Find your next steps and become a new Gator!
Freshmen Admissions
Transfer Admissions
Graduate Admissions
International Admissions
Cost of Attendance and Financial Aid
We believe that money shouldn’t come between you and a great education. SF State is ranked in the top 25 for U.S. universities on CollegeNet’s Social Mobility Index, continuously working to make education affordable and help students graduate and find good-paying jobs.
Tuition and Aid
Learn more about
tuition + aid
at SF State →
Visit SF State
Explore the beauty of the SF State campus through guided tours from student ambassadors.
“
Our students are like no others.
They are diverse in every sense of the word. They bring their rich lives into the classroom and contribute so that we all learn from each other.
”
—
Susanna Jones
Professor of Social Work
Faculty Director, First-Year Experience
Campus Tours
Already Admitted?
Accept your admission offer, learn about orientation, explore housing and more!
Information for Admitted Students
Looking for more information?
Request Information
Schedule a Call

title: Admissions FAQ | Future Students
content:
Admissions FAQ
The following FAQs are provided to help you answer some of your pressing questions so you can continue taking the next steps toward your future at SF State.
Can I visit SF State for a tour?
Please visit our
Campus Visits & Tours
page for the most up-to-date information on in-person and virtual tour options.
How can I contact the Office of Undergraduate Admissions and Recruitment?
We are available to support you through your next steps of the college admission process. Here's how you can get in touch with us:
Phone
Available: Monday – Friday, 8:30 a.m. – 5 p.m. Pacific Time
Domestic admissions: 415-338-6486
International admissions: +1 415-338-2382
Prospective students: 415-338-2355
Email
Domestic admissions:
ugadmit@sfsu.edu
International admissions:
ugintl@sfsu.edu
Prospective students:
outreach@sfsu.edu
In Person
One Stop Student Service Center
Student Services Building, First Floor
Regular Hours: Monday – Friday, 9:00 a.m. – 5 p.m. Pacific Time
How can I submit documents to the Admissions Office?
Documents can be sent by mail to:
San Francisco State University
Office of Undergraduate Admissions
1600 Holloway Avenue
San Francisco, CA 94132
Or you can drop documents off at the Admissions Window in the One Stop on the first floor of the Student Services Building.
See our guide on
submitting transcripts
for more information.
What if I can't pay for the confirmation deposit to accept my admission offer?
Some students qualify for an
automatic waiver
. If you are not eligible for the automatic waiver and have a financial hardship, please contact us at
ugadmit@sfsu.edu
.
I was admitted to SF State but did not enroll in classes. Can I attend the University at a later date?
If you do not enroll in the term of your admission then you must reapply for future admission consideration and meet the requirements that are in effect at that time.
Incoming First-Time Freshmen
Will receiving credit or pass grades affect my admission to SF State?
A-G college preparatory courses taken in Winter, Spring, Summer or Fall 2020 terms and during Winter, Spring or Summer 2021 terms will be accepted with grades of "Credit" or "Pass".
All other coursework must be graded and a grade of C- or better must be earned for the course to satisfy “a-g” requirements.
Grades of credit/pass or no credit/no pass will not be included in the calculation of high school GPA.
Are the SAT and ACT tests required?
The CSU is no longer using ACT/SAT examinations in determining admission eligibility. Please see the
Freshmen Admission Eligibility Requirements
for more information.
Will SF State still accept AP exams using the new online format?
Yes, the change in the Advanced Placement test format does not change SF State’s policy regarding
awarding AP credits
.
Incoming Transfer Students
Will receiving credit or pass grades for my courses affect my admission?
Course with credit or pass grades will satisfy the General Education requirements [Oral Communication (Area A1), Written Communication (Area A2), Critical Thinking (Area A3) and Quantitative Reasoning (Area B4)]. Grades of credit/pass or no credit/non-passing will not affect your transfer GPA. Baccalaureate-level courses with credit/pass grades will still be counted in your transferable units.
Incoming International Students
Which English proficiency exams do you accept?
Please visit
our website
for a list of tests we accept and the scores required, including the TOEFL Special Home Edition and the IELTS Indicator.
My visa was denied or delayed. Can I still attend?
If you have questions or concerns about your F-1 status, please contact our F-1 advisors at
f1@sfsu.edu
.
